name.text: Open Research Conversation: Opening up Ethnography

node.summary: Join us for an examination of the challenges and opportunities of ethnographic research in the context of open research practices

name.text: Open Access Monographs, WRUP & the Sheffield Thesis Publishing Prize

node.summary: Join us to celebrate the inaugural University of Sheffield Thesis Publishing Prize and discuss open access monographs more widely.

name.text: Reframing Research Data: Open Research Outputs in the Arts and Humanities

node.summary: Join us for an exploration of issues around data, archiving and sharing in Arts and Humanities subjects.

name.text: Open Research Conversation: Reproducibility and the Curriculum

node.summary: Join us for a discussion of how to embed reproducible workflows, data management and transparent documentation in taught programmes.
Join us to explore how University of Sheffield researchers can get the most out of our membership of Dryad.

name.text: You've Got to Fight for Your (Copy)right: Rights Retention Policy

node.summary: This session offers an opportunity to explore the new Rights Retention Policy with copyright & licensing staff from the University Library.

name.text: Open Research Conversation: Open Research and Public Engagement

node.summary: Join us for a thought-provoking exploration of the intersections between public engagement and open research.

name.text: Opening the (e)Book on Open Educational Resources

node.summary: Join us to explore the possibilities for learning and teaching created by Open Educational Resources.

name.text: University of Sheffield Inaugural Annual Open Research Lecture

node.summary: Speaker: Professor Tom Stafford, Senior Lecturer (Dept of Psychology) and University Research Practice Lead.

frontmatter.title: Visualising Cultural Heritage Data
frontmatter.description: Data visualisation for cultural heritage collections workshop presented by Dr Olivia Vane of The British Library on N8 CIR Training.

frontmatter.title: Urban Observatories hackathon
frontmatter.description: The University of Sheffield hosted a three-day hackathon aimed to begin tackling the complex challenges involved in coordinating analytics using data from urban observatories across the UK.
